{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3716033,"name":"","username":"StarManTheGamer","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/a698b9/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-08-15T19:28:49.182Z","cooked":"

Hi everyone,

Three weeks ago our team purchased the MAXSwerve Kit as well as our very first Power Distribution Hub from REV Robotics. Within one week of having our new hub and having it connected and running our swerve modules, we noticed that some of our lights that control our fuses weren’t working. Upon connecting to our robot, it says we have a Hardware Fault as well as the CSA Channel Read Fault being active.

The channel lights that actively aren’t working are 18 and 19, as well as 20 and 21.

I did some of my own investigating and I’m aware that this is something beyond my control, but we literally just got our hub. Is there something that can cause this? And more so, is this something we can fix? We’d like to have our entire hub system working since it’s brand new and we just got it.

Worst case scenario, we’ll contact REV Robotics since it started doing this within the first week of having the product. We’d like to know what causes it though so we can prevent it if it’s something we did, or if it’s something just beyond our control.

Thanks!

StarManTheGamer:

Worst case scenario, we’ll contact REV Robotics

Why not just contact REV? They will be able to give you the best answer and ask the best follow-up questions. FRC vendors tend to be very helpful; they know they are selling products to a wide variety of users with varying experience levels.
